attachments.fallback: [EqualifyEverything/equalify-api] 1 new commit pushed to _main_ by bbertucc

attachments.title: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify-api/issues/2|#2 Integrate Authentication>

attachments.text:
*Overview*

Requests add, remove, and get DB content.

*NOTE:*

☐ Every request will return `status` (success/error), `message`, and `result` objects.
☐ An overview of current DB architecture is available here: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/install.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/install.php>
☐ Every DB is named related to a user account (see <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify-api/issues/2|#2> for more info)

*/get Requests*

These requests get content from the DB:

*/get/results*

☐ Optionally filtered by `propertyIds`, `urlIds`, `nodeIds`, `nodeUpdateIds`, `messageIds`, and `tagIds`.
☐ Returns results from `nodes`, `node_updates`, `messages`, `tags`, `message_nodes`, `message_tags`, `urls`, and `properties` DB tables as JSON in valid <https://github.com/equalifyEverything/equalify-schema|Equalify Schema>.
☐ Messages, Tags, Properties, Pages are sorted by properties related to the most nodes with `nodeEqualified` set to "false" - most to least.

*NOTE:*  
This PHP script was used to generate results without filters in the past: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/api.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/api.php>

*/get/properties*

☐ Optionally filtered by array with `propertIds`, string with `propertyDiscovery` set, or array with `propertyUrls`.
☐ Returns results from `properties` DB table as JSON

*/get/updates*

☐ Optionally filtered by `startDate` and`endDate`.
☐ Returns results from `node_updates` DB table as JSON

*/get/scans*

☐ Optionally filtered by `scanIds`
☐ Returns results from `queued_scans` DB table as JSON

*NOTE:*  
This existing PHP script did many of the functions described: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/helpers/get_scans.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/helpers/get_scans.php>

*/get/reports*

☐ Optionally filtered by `reportIds`
☐ Returns results from `reports` DB table as JSON

*NOTE:*  
This existing PHP script did many of the functions described: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/helpers/get_reports.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/helpers/get_reports.php>

*/add Requests*

These requests add content to the DB:

*/add/results*

☐ Processes and adds data formatted in <https://github.com/equalifyEverything/equalify-schema|Equalify schema> to DB.
☐ Checks if properties are new. If so, adds properties. If not, uses id of existing properties.
☐ Checks if urls are new. If so, adds urls. If not, uses id of existing url.
☐ Checks if messages are new. If so, adds message. If not, uses id of existing message.
☐ Checks if tags are new. If so, adds tag. If not, uses id of existing tag.
☐ Checks if node is new (new nodes must be unique html + targets and relate to a unique URL). Adds if so. Uses existing id, if not.
☐ Checks if node update is new. If so, adds update. If not, uses existing id.
☐ Returns IDs related to added URLs, properties, messages, tags, nodes, and updates.

*NOTE:*  
This PHP script did many of the same functions we need `add/results` to do: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/process_scans.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/process_scans.php>

*/add/scans*

☐ Requires existing `urlIds`
☐ Validates to make sure `urlIds` exist.
☐ Adds URL info to `queuedScans`.
☐ Returns new scan ids

*/add/reports*

☐ Requires `reportName` and `filters`.
☐ `filters` is an array that includes optional arrays of `propertyIds`, `urlIds`, `nodeIds`, `nodeUpdateIds`, `messageIds`, `tagIds`
☐ Validates to make sure `filters` data exists.
☐ Returns new `reportIds`

*NOTE:*  
These existing PHP script did many of the functions described:

• <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_report_filter_change.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_report_filter_change.php>
• <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_report_title.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_report_title.php>

*/add/properties*

☐ Requires `propertyName`, `propertyDiscovery` ("single_page_import" / "sitemap_import" / "manually_added"), and `propertyUrl`.
☐ Validates to make sure `propertyDiscovery` ("single_page_import" / "sitemap_import" / "manually_added") and `propertyUrl` is valid
☐ Returns new `propertyIds`

*NOTE:*  
These existing PHP scripts did many of the functions described:

• <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/add_single_property.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/add_single_property.php>
• <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/add_csv_properties.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/add_csv_properties.php>

*/update Requests*

The requests update existing content:

*/update/properties*

☐ Requires `propertyId` and any either new `propertyName`, `propertyDiscovery` ("single_page_import" / "sitemap_import" / "manually_added"), and/or `propertyURL`
☐ Validates to make sure `propertyId` exists, `propertyDiscovery` is valid, and `propertyURL` is valid.
☐ Returns fields that were saved with related `propertyIds`

*NOTE:*  
This existing PHP script did many of the functions described: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_property_settings.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_property_settings.php>

*/update/reports*

☐ Requires `reportId` and either `reportName` and/or `reportFilters`.
☐ `filters` is an array that includes arrays of `propertyIds`, `urlIds`, `nodeIds`, `nodeUpdateIds`, `messageIds`, `tagIds`
☐ Validates to make sure every entry in `filters` exist, formatting is valid, and `reportId` exists.
☐ Returns fields that were saved with related `propertyIds`

*NOTE:*  
These existing PHP scripts did many of the functions described:

• <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_report_filter_change.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_report_filter_change.php>
• <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_report_title.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/save_report_title.php>

*/delete/properties*

☐ Requires `propertyId`
☐ Deletes property and all nodes and node updates related to the property, as well as any saved report filters related to the property and the node ids that were deleted
☐ Returns propertyIds of deleted properties

*NOTE:*  
This existing PHP script did many of the functions described: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/delete_property.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/delete_property.php>

*/delete/reports*

☐ Requires `reportId`
☐ Deletes reports related to given ids
☐ Returns reportIds of deleted reports

*NOTE:*  
This existing PHP script did many of the functions described: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/delete_report.php|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/blob/v1-rc5/actions/delete_report.php>

*LLM Request*

This is a rough idea of what LLM-related requests would do because it's not created yet.

*/help*

☐ Ideally, takes results formatted in Equalify schema and returns LLM suggestion
attachments.title: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify-api/issues/3|#3 Create Request Endpoints>
